name: dawning
content:

starting to happen or become known or obvious: There is a dawning realization that we cannot continue to deplete the planet. The dawning promise of replacement therapy has shifted his outlook on life.
More examplesFewer examples In the late 19th century, there was the dawning knowledge that the area around the Persian Gulf was rich with oil.She had the dawning recognition that a lot of people in the company weren't happy.You can see the dawning awareness of responsibility on Hank's face.
